data.title: Lake-effect snow around Erie delays schools, slows interstate traffic. Get the forecast.
data.meta_description: A lake-effect snow warning is in place for Erie and Crawford counties through Wednesday at 7 a.m. Return to GoErie all day for updates.
data.text:
The latest updates about the lake-effect snow in and around Erie County on Tuesday.

Return for updates.

Amount of snow varies throughout region

The initial snow totals reported varied throughout Erie and Crawford counties.

Edinboro received 13 inches over a 12-hour span from 7 p.m. Monday to 7 a.m. today.

Erie International Airport had 3 inches total since Monday through 11:30 a.m. today.

Three-day forecast shows changing weather conditions

The lake-effect snow warning issued by the National Weather Service office in Cleveland remains in place for Erie and Crawford counties until Wednesday at 7 a.m.

The weather service forecast for Tuesday in Erie calls for the possibility of another 1 inch to 3 inches of snow, plus blowing snow as winds gust as high as 33 mph. The high temperature will be around 30 degrees.

Snow showers are expected to taper off by around 3 a.m. Wednesday, though an additional inch to 3 inches is possible by then. The overnight low will be around 21 and wind gusts as high as 28 mph.

There is a slight chance of snow Wednesday, mainly after 1 p.m. The high will be near 36. Rain and snow are possible Wednesday night, when the low will be around 31.

Thursday? Mostly sunny with a high springboarding back to around 47. Gusty winds will continue.

More: See power outages around Erie in the past 24 hours

Normal speed limits restored on Erie-area interstates

The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation has restored the speed limit on Interstates 79, 86, and 90 in the Northwest Region. They had been reduced to 45 mph.

Jackknifed truck blocks I-90 lanes

A semi that jackknifed along a portion of Interstate 90 in western Erie County highlighted the weather-related traffic accidents that have occurred in the Erie region during the latest snow event.

The accident occurred overnight along I-90 just east of the Route 18 Girard/Platea interchange, according to Erie County 911. I-90 in that area was closed for a time as crews cleaned up the accident, but the interstate had reopened by 7 a.m. Tuesday, authorities reported.

Pennsylvania State Police Troop E reported that, between the time the snow started falling on Monday and Tuesday morning, troopers had responded to 18 motor vehicle crashes and assisted 28 other motorists who slid off roadways. Troopers additionally responded to 12 reports of items including branches that were knocked onto area roadways by strong winds.

No notable weather-related accidents or road closures were reported in Crawford County Tuesday morning.

Lake-effect snow warning through 7 a.m. Wednesday

A lake-effect snow warning remains in place for Erie and Crawford counties through Wednesday at 7 a.m.

The National Weather Service in Cleveland forecasts an additional 4 inches to 12 inches of lake-effect snow, with the heaviest new snowfall near and south of Interstate 90. Winds at times could gust as high as 30 mph.

Lake-effect snow warnings also are in place in Warren County until Wednesday at 1 a.m.; and in Chautauqua County, New York, and Ashtabula County, Ohio, until Wednesday at 7 a.m.

Winter weather advisories are in effect until Tuesday at 7 p.m. in Venango and Mercer counties.

Some school districts delay start of classes

A handful of school districts in Erie and Crawford counties are operating under 2-hour delays Tuesday morning. Northwestern School District is closed today.

Erie PA school delays for Nov. 28, 2023

Interstate speed limits reduced

The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation has temporarily educed the speed limit to 45 mph on interstates around Erie:

Interstate 79 from the beginning of I-79 in Erie County to Exit 166 (Route 6N/Edinboro/Albion);

Interstate 86 from the beginning of I-86 to the New York state line; and

Interstate 90 from the Ohio state line to the New York state line.

The speed limit has been restored on Interstate 80.

Snowmaking starts at ski resorts

Peek'n Peak in Findley Lake, New York, and Mount Pleasant of Edinboro won't let the weather go to waste. The ski resorts' snow guns are turned on.

Snow could bring out best in Erie holiday events

A coating of snow could put an added touch of winter into holiday festivities scheduled around the area.
